title: Property Client Advisor - Energy & Power
description:
Marsh is seeking candidates for our open Client Advisor position based in our New York City or Houston offices:

**Property Client Advisor – Energy & Power**


What can you expect:

* Becoming a member of Marsh's best in class Power & Energy team who delivers expert broking & strategy solutions to help manage risk with confidence.
* In this Client Advisor role, you will develop an understanding of the clients' business strategic priorities, risk strategies and risk management needs to help provide knowledge and advice to complex clients.
* Helps identify the need for new products and develops innovative solutions for clients.
* Completes policy management activities and delivery of reviewed policy to client and helps address client inquiries as necessary.
* Delivers technical expertise in the delivery and presentation of RFP’s


What's in it for you?

* Gain exposure to key stakeholders and have the ability to make strong business connections.
* An opportunity for long term growth within a dynamic and growing business unit.
* Ability to make an immediate impact to support our book of business and growth of the organization.
* Exceptional benefits, great time off and additional perks that come with working at Marsh.


We will count on you to:

* Maintain and manage existing book of Energy & Power clients through daily interaction of clients’ needs.
* Work with various Energy Property Insurance markets to place Marsh clients with for best terms and conditions available in the market place.
* Populate casualty market submissions, negotiate terms and conditions with underwriters and communicates quotes to clients.
* Responsible for overseeing the correct issuance of all documentation pertaining to the transaction including, but not limited to invoicing, policy review and all pre and post binding documentation.
* Responsible for setting up and managing client Renewal Strategy Meetings between Marsh, client and carrier 120 days prior to renewal.


What you need to have:

* 5+ years Industry experience: Energy & Power experience necessary
* P&C license a must, or ability to obtain
* Bachelors' degree preferred


What makes you stand out?

* Ability to build strong relationships and build rapport with internal colleagues, clients and carriers.
* Self-starter, resourcefulness with the ability to bring solutions and ideas to the firm.
* Being able to be part of a collaborative team and feel that you can make an immediate impact.

You will work closely with various stakeholders, including IT teams, HR, and business leaders, to develop and implement access control policies and procedures. Additionally, you will be responsible for monitoring access requests, conducting periodic access reviews, and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.

title: Cyber Strategy Manager
description:
Marsh has a new and exciting opening created in our Cyber Practice sitting in the US.


Cyber Strategy Manager


What can you expect:

* The Cyber Strategy Manager will execute, develop & facilitate client strategy meetings, in addition to supporting some of our other key offerings.
* Become a member of Marsh's cyber team who delivers expert advisory and market-leading solutions to help manage cyber risk with confidence.
* Help identify the need for new products and develop innovative cyber solutions for clients.
* Build and maintains relationships with clients and key partners, along with internal stakeholders.


What's in it for you?

* Gain exposure to key stakeholders and have the ability to make strong business connections.
* An opportunity for long term growth within a dynamic and growing business unit.
* Ability to make an immediate impact to support our book of business and growth of the organization.
* Ability to influence and shape how organizations understand, measure and manage cyber risk to create meaningful change.
* Work for an organization that is on the front lines of shaping the future of cyber risk management.


We will count on you to:

* Drive and support the development of the overall client strategy meeting (CSM) and document / model development
* Quarterback the development of each client-specific deck in collaboration with key stakeholders.
* Collaborate with brokerage, cybersecurity, risk intelligence and cyber incident management to ensure we’re responding to clients’ cyber risk priorities.
* Lead each CSM discussion in conjunction with the cyber broker and other cyber SMEs.
* Support the delivery of cyber incident management offerings and the cyber incident management team (active incident response, table tops, vendor ecosystem support)
* Identify opportunities for improvement and potential new cyber solutions – including ideas around packaging and delivery.


What you need to have:

* 10+ years Cybersecurity and/or CISO experience necessary
* 5+ Incident management/incident response experience
* Bachelors' degree preferred


What makes you stand out:

* Ability to build strong relationships and resonate with internal colleagues, clients and key external partners.
* Self-starter, resourcefulness with the ability to bring solutions and ideas to the firm.

description:

* Diversity in day-to-day activities with moderate levels of travel across the U.S. and potentially internationally

description:
**Our not-so-secret sauce.**


Award-winning, inclusive, Top Workplace culture doesn’t happen overnight. It’s a result of hard work by extraordinary people. title: Morningside Park Farmers Market Manager
description:
APPLY NOW  

Posted 7/29/24  




Part-time, $19/hour position available at our year-round Morningside Park Farmers Market in Manhattan. Work hours are weekly on Saturdays from 7am-3pm at the market, located near the corner of West 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue, and a few additional hours at home to file reports and occasionally in the field to help with promotion (generally a total of 8-10 hours weekly).


This is an ideal position for someone with retail, management, customer service, teaching, or other leadership experience, who is interested in learning about and contributing to the local food system. You should be friendly and happy to talk to all kinds of people, willing to do some physical work, able to communicate clearly and with confidence to both your Down to Earth colleagues and the vendors and customers in the market, organized and aware of the importance of good record keeping and reporting.


The Farmers Market Manager oversees day-of-market operations as Down to Earth Markets' on-site representative, working closely with the company's office team to help ensure the market's success and spearhead interactions with market vendors, shoppers and the community:


* Supervising and managing daily operations to assure a smooth- and safe-running market
* Enforcing market rules and regulations
* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers
* Assisting shoppers and vendors with use of food access and nutrition programs (SNAP, FMNP)
* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions
* Attending weekly conference calls with fellow managers and the Operations Manager

Occasionally filling in for fellow site managers at other market locations  
* 

Physical / schedule requirements:


* Commit to consistently working 8-10 hours a week
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
* Able to walk and stand for several hours at a time
* Able to work in all weather conditions, e.g. heat, cold, rain, sun, wind, snow
* Lead market set up and breakdown, including directing people and vehicles, moving equipment, and cleaning up the market site as needed
* Complete two days of shadowing alongside another site manager at another farmers market as part of training
* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
* Communicate regularly, effectively, and in detail, including filing timely reports, to ensure a steady flow of information between the market and the office
* Monitor and reply to messages from the office, especially around end-of market reporting and pre-market prep
* Have use of a smartphone to use Microsoft Teams, our reporting web app, and Facebook/Instagram/Meta Business Suite during the market day

We are seeking candidates who are available to start immediately. Training will be provided.  

APPLY NOW


-


Down to Earth Markets is a mission-driven Benefit Corporation and Certified B Corporation using business as a power for positive change in the world.


All employment decisions that Down to Earth makes are based on organizational needs, job requirements and the employee's or applicant's qualifications. We are an equal opportunity employer. All job applicants are welcome regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.


  
### **If you're interested in one of the above opportunities, email your cover letter and résumé to** **[email protected]****.**

title: Consultant - Risk Consulting
description:
Emerging Risk Group is seeking candidates for the following position to be ideally based in New York or Chicago, but we will accept remote candidates.


The Emerging Risks Group specializes in connecting risk and strategy for our clients through the deployment of predictive analytics analyzing risk in our clients’ value chains. The group is made up of four verticals - Cyber, ESG and Climate, Geopolitical Risk, and Operational Resiliency. Our team members serve as trusted, strategic risk advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear data-driven choices about managing risk to drive growth and enterprise value through delivery of deep industry expertise, rigorous analytical capabilities, and a pragmatic approach to solve our client’s most complex business and risk challenges.


**Emerging Risk Consultant**

**What can you expect?**

* Identify risk to growth and value creation strategies (both insurable and non-insurable losses)
* Evaluate the appropriate business models, operating models, and capabilities to support their strategic vision and de-risk their operating environment
* Address both operational and strategic risks to our clients’ operating models
* Maximize the ROI on risk capital
* Strong interpersonal and influencing skills

**What is in it for you?**

* A company with a strong brand, with experience developing solutions for todays and tomorrow’s toughest challenges
* A culture of internal mobility, diversity, inclusion, and collaboration
* Employee Resource Groups which provide access to leaders, relevant volunteer and mentoring opportunities, and interactions with counterparts in industry groups and client organizations
* Flexible work opportunities for work/life balance
* Competitive pay and a full benefits package, starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, Vision, Short- and Long-Term Disability and Life Insurance, Employee Stock Purchase program, and a generous paid time-off allowance); plus a fixed company contribution AND a company match on your 401k, after one year of service

**We will count on you to:**

* Have a passion for learning, professional growth and knowledge sharing
* A desire to be part of an entrepreneurial, fast-paced and fun team environment
* Experience assessing strategy and making recommendations to clients
* Show strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with experience exercising mature judgment
* Knowledge of or experience in broader operations functions (i.e. HR, IT, Finance, Procurement, Commercial Operations, Cybersecurity)
* Have strong interpersonal skills

**What you need to have:**

* Bachelor's degree with a record of outstanding academic achievement
* 4+ years of relevant consulting or prior experience in a research or business analyst role
* Strong quantitative and analytical skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication

**What makes you stand out?**

* Undergraduate major in in economics, engineering, finance or accounting or an advanced degree in business (e.g., MBA) from a top tier program
* Experience and comfort in using analytical methods to create project analysis and recommendation support
* Ability to build Excel, Python and or R operating models


Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer, and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marshmclennan.com, follow us on LinkedIn and X.


Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, veteran status (including protected veterans), or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by contacting TANA@mmc.com


Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

  

The applicable base salary range for this role is $84,700 to $180,800.


The base pay offered will be determined on factors such as experience, skills, training, location, certifications, education, and any applicable minimum wage requirements. Decisions will be determined on a case-by-case basis. In addition to the base salary, this position may be eligible for performance-based incentives.  

  

We are excited to offer a competitive total rewards package which includes health and welfare benefits, tuition assistance, 401K savings and other retirement programs as well as employee assistance programs.

description:

title: Global Tax Audit & Controversy Lead
description:
**Marsh McLennan** is seeking candidates for the following position based in the **London or New York** office:

**Global Tax Audit & Controversy Lead**

**What can you expect?**

* The Global Tax Audit & Controversy Lead (the “Controversy Lead”) is responsible for assisting with the oversight and management of all tax controversy matters for Marsh McLennan, a large multinational organization operating in more than one hundred countries.
* This role offers a unique opportunity to establish and operate a tax audit management framework and work with a talented team of tax and finance professionals.
* The position requires a deep understanding of tax laws and regulations in multiple jurisdictions, as well as the ability to navigate complex tax disputes and negotiations with tax authorities.
* The Controversy Lead will report into the Head of International Advisory, Reporting & Controversy.
**What you will be rewarded with?**

* Competitive Benefits Package including: 27 days annual leave, up to 4 days flexible bank holidays, excellent pension contributions, private medical cover, life assurance, income protection, employee assistance program, plus a range of flexible benefits including the option to buy or sell up to 5 days holiday per year, cycle to work, dental insurance, health assessments plus many more.
* Generous Family Leave including: 6 months paid maternity leave, 4 months paid paternity leave, 6 months paid adoption leave plus shared parental leave options. To help ease the transition when you return to work you will be able to work 8 weeks at 80% of your normal work pattern and receive 100% of your normal salary.

**We will rely on you to:**

* Designing and implementing tax controversy function framework for the organization, including standardized end-to-end processes dealing with audit readiness, tracking, governance, and risk management.
* Developing and implementing tax controversy strategies: Working with the Head of International Tax Advisory, Reporting & Compliance, to develop and implementing strategies to effectively manage and resolve tax disputes. This includes assessing the company's tax positions, identifying potential risks, and developing strategies to mitigate those risks.
* Managing tax audits and investigations: The Controversy Lead will help coordinate the management of individual tax audits and investigations working with members of the internal tax team and other Finance partners. This includes facilitating responses to information requests and working with group team members to ensure consistency in strategy in discussions and negotiations with tax authorities.
* Providing guidance and support to regional tax and specialist teams: The Controversy Lead provides guidance and support to regional tax teams on tax controversy matters. This includes advising on tax positions, providing technical expertise, and assisting with the resolution of complex tax issues.
* Monitoring and staying up to date with tax laws and regulations: The Controversy Lead must stay informed about changes in tax laws and regulations including judicial developments relevant to the jurisdictions in which we operate. This also involves engaging with external tax advisors to ensure the company's tax positions are compliant with applicable laws.
* Managing external advisors and consultants: The Controversy Lead will help manage engagement of external advisors and consultants to provide specialized expertise or support in tax controversy matters. This includes reviewing work performed by external advisors, and ensuring the company receives high-quality and cost-effective services.
* Reporting and compliance: The Controversy Lead is responsible for tracking all controversies and reporting on tax controversy matters to the Head of International Tax Advisory, Reporting & Controversy, other Tax senior management, and relevant stakeholders. This includes providing updates on ongoing disputes, assessing potential financial impacts, and ensuring compliance with reporting requirements.

**What you need to have:**

* The ideal candidate will have a law degree and an accounting or finance background.
* Strong leadership and project management skills.
* Effective communication and negotiation skills are crucial for this role.
* Ability to partner with stakeholders to establish and operate the framework and meet audit requirements in a timely manner and manage multiple audits at the same time.
* A deep understanding of tax laws, regulations, and principles in multiple jurisdictions is critical.
* Be well-versed in international tax planning, transfer pricing, tax treaties, and other relevant tax concepts.
* A proven record of successfully managing tax controversies and disputes. This includes experience in handling tax audits, negotiating with tax authorities, and resolving complex tax issues.
* Ability to analyze financial data and be able to assess impact of actions across multiple jurisdictions.
* Knowledge of Marsh McLennan’s businesses, footprint, operations, objectives, and industry dynamics are extremely helpful to align tax strategies with business goals and provide strategic advice to senior management.
**MARSH MCLENNAN**

Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) is the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The Company’s more than 85,000 colleagues advise clients in over 130 countries. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses. Marsh provides data-driven risk advisory services and insurance solutions to commercial and consumer clients. Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities. Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations redefine the world of work, reshape retirement and investment outcomes, and unlock health and well being for a changing workforce. Oliver Wyman serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. For more information, visit marshmclennan.com, or follow us on LinkedIn and X.


Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age background, civil partnership status, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, gender reassignment, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.


We are an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to providing reasonable adjustments in accordance with applicable law to any candidate with a disability to allow them to fully participate in the recruitment process. If you have a disability that may require reasonable adjustments, please contact us at reasonableaccommodations@mmc.com

title: Engagement Lead - Risk Consulting
description:
The Property Risk Consulting Group works with our clients to improve their property resiliency and partners with clients and Marsh broking teams to improve placement outcomes through development of stronger risk management practices.


Our team members serve as trusted, strategic risk advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear choices about managing risk based on risk engineering principles and data-driven insights. The importance of this has never been higher as our clients seek to manage TCOR while retaining more risk, exploring alternative risk transfer solutions, and making risk improvement investments.


Marsh is seeking candidates for the following position based out of any U.S. office location**:**

**What can you expect?**

* Provide advice on risk mitigation across all property risk perils and coordinate client service independently or in combination with Marsh colleagues
* in support of client objectives you will makes technical recommendations on design of protection systems and manage loss prevention program execution
* Visit client sites to produce comprehensive property site evaluation reports and/or to supervise third party engineers
* Create presentations and facilitate client and market meetings to gain consensus on risk improvement strategies.
* Use data and analytics from Marsh proprietary systems to help clients prioritize risk improvement decisions and maximize ROI on risk capital, technology, and cybersecurity investments
* Work with other Marsh Advisory teams to bring holistic solutions to our clients; for example our Business Continuity, Forensic Accounting and Climate Risk teams all work closely with our property risk consultants

**What is in it for you?**

* A seat at the table to influence client decision making and to support clients with implementation of risk management strategies
* A company with a strong brand, with experience developing solutions for todays and tomorrow’s toughest challenges
* A culture of internal mobility, diversity, inclusion, and collaboration
* Employee Resource Groups which provide access to leaders, relevant volunteer and mentoring opportunities, and interactions with counterparts in industry groups and client organizations
* Flexible work opportunities for work/life balance
* Competitive pay and a full benefits package, starting Day 1 (Medical, Dental, Vision, Short- and Long-Term Disability and Life Insurance, Employee Stock Purchase program, and a generous paid time-off allowance); plus a fixed company contribution AND a company match on your 401k, after one year of service.

**We will count on you to:**

* Demonstrate proven experience effectively leading project teams
* Have Strong interpersonal and influencing skills
* Be up-to-date on industry trends, technical changes around property risk issues to improve client's risk management programs
* Experience providing Technical Risk Assessments and the ability to communicate the findings stakeholders
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with experience exercising mature judgment
* Demonstrated business development success
* Strong quantitative and analytical skills
* A desire to be part of an entrepreneurial, fast-paced and fun team environment

**What you need to have:**

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering
* Minimum 5 to 10 years managing large accounts
* Highly Protected Risk background

**What makes you stand out?**

* Ability to consult with others in collaborative environments
* Strong presentation and influencing skills
* Comfort working with data to drive client insights


Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser. With more than 45,000 colleagues operating in more than 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the leading global professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of over $20 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer, and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marshmclennan.com, follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.


Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, veteran status (including protected veterans), or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.


If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by contacting TANA@mmc.com


Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

title: VP, Financial Associate
description:
Guy Carpenter’s Rating Advisory Team consists of experienced professionals who help effectively and efficiently manage our clients' rating agency relationship. Our Rating Advisory experts work in collaboration with the rest of the client's Guy Carpenter team to provide best-in-class solutions that help achieve their strategic and rating goals.


We are currently seeking an VP level candidate in the New York or Philadelphia office.


**What to expect:**

* You are an analytical and goal-oriented individual who will contribute to developing in-depth sector and financial analysis for our clients.
* You will support a senior colleague with illustrating the financial and rating agency impact of alternative reinsurance structures, capital management plans and expansion strategies.

**What's in it for you?**

* A company with a strong Brand and strong results to match.
* Employee Resource Groups that provide access to leaders, relevant volunteer and mentoring opportunities and interactions with counterparts in industry groups and client organizations.
* Social Impact volunteering opportunities available for all colleagues through a network of colleague and business partnerships.
* Competitive pay (salary and bonus potential), Full benefits package – starting day one (medical, dental, vision, STI/LTI, life insurance, generous 401k match AND contribution.
* After six months, eligible for up to $10k tuition reimbursement per year and participation in our Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

**We will count on you to:**

* Analyze financial statements, assess business and industry risks, and evaluate business strategies.
* Assist with developing analysis on a pro forma and forecasted basis to advise our clients on the financial and rating agency impact of decisions associated with reinsurance purchase, capital management and expansion plans.
* Develop tools to optimize the analysis and dissemination of financial data
* Contribute to the firm’s body of knowledge through active internal communication to keep abreast of changing risk and insurance market conditions.
* Build and maintain client and market contacts, at appropriate levels, to execute effectively on client management.
* Solving moderately complex problems by taking a new perspective on existing solutions.
* Contribute to client retention through effective risk solutions and excellence in service.

**What you need to have:**

* Bachelor’s degree, 5-7 years of relevant (re)insurance experience
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Skilled in Excel and Microsoft Office

**What makes you stand out:**

* Insurance credit and/or accounting knowledge
* MBA and/or CFA
* Proficiency in R, Python, Power BI

title: Information Architect
description:
At Mercer, we make a difference in the lives of more than 110 million people every day by advancing their health, wealth, and careers. We are in the business of creating more secure and rewarding futures for our clients and their employees — whether we are designing affordable health plans, assuring income for retirement, or aligning workers with workforce needs.


Mercer is seeking candidates for the following position with option to be based in any Mercer office located in Eastern time zone:

**Information Architect**

**What can you expect?**

* As part of the Global Investment Data Team, this is a critical role to define how Mercer matures in its data management processes as we embark on a global transformation program.
* Be responsible for developing and implementing an information architecture approach that supports our data strategy.
* We are looking for an individual who is deeply knowledgeable in data and information architecture and can help implement solutions in a way that is not overly process heavy.
* You will play a crucial role in improving trust in data with our business users and will need to take a pragmatic approach to balancing and prioritizing requests in a world where budgets are constrained.

**What is in it for you?**

* A company with a strong brand and strong results to match
* Culture of internal mobility, collaboration and valued partnership with the business.
* Employee Resource Groups, which provide access to leaders, relevant volunteer and mentoring opportunities and interactions with counterparts in industry groups and client organizations.
* Competitive pay (salary and performance bonus potential), full benefits package – starting day one (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, generous 401k match AND contribution).
* Flexible work opportunities for work/life balance
* Tuition Reimbursement plan per year and participation in our Employee Stock Purchase Plan

**We will Count on you to:**

* As the Mercer Wealth Investment Information Architect, you will lead the development of best practices for building solutions that promote effective data management. You will establish processes to ensure the quality, completeness, timeliness, and ownership of data challenges are met.
* Your role will involve developing an information blueprint that implements a single-source of truth and authoritative sources of data principles. You will also ensure that all projects align with this vision.
* In line with Mercer's transformative journey, we are rolling out the next generation of data platforms to establish ourselves as a leading competitor in the Investment Assets Management Industry. As part of this effort, you will collaborate with regional Investment Data Solutions leaders to design solutions and make sure that they address all data management principles.
* You will also help implement a Data Product approach to improve the accessibility and usability of data across the firm.
* Your contributions to developing these solutions will drive the growth and transformation of our organization, enabling us to stay ahead in a rapidly evolving industry. This role offers an exciting opportunity to collaborate with teams across different regions and make a significant impact on Mercer's global operations.
* You will develop target data architecture for the firm outlining critical functions and the flow of information to support those functions

**What you need to have:**

* Proven experience in architecting and implementing Business Intelligence and Data repository platforms, Master Data Management, and data integration solutions.
* Proven background in Investment Data Management Domain that includes exposure to building master data applications such as Security Master, and building out Book of Records such as Account and Investment Book of Records (ABOR/IBOR)
* Experience in modern data platforms to support both descriptive and predictive data analysis capabilities across the firm.
* Experience in working closely with technology teams in implementing both relational and non-relational data platforms.
* Functional understanding of data engineering principles, best practices, and supporting technologies.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

**What Makes You Stand Out?**

* Foster collaborative working relationships with global teams, internal colleagues, and third-party suppliers.
* Proven experience in taking a hands-on and entrepreneurial approach to problem solving finding the right balance between tactical and strategic solutions.
* Exposure to products like Charles River, State Street Alpha, and Factset
* Experience in developing and rolling out light weight governance processes to promote a culture of implementing strong data management practices in a decentralized model


Mercer believes in building brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s more than 20,000 employees are based in 43 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with more than 85,000 colleagues and annual revenue of over $23 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit mercer.com. Follow Mercer on LinkedIn and X.

title: Environmental Funding Specialist (New York)
description:
Woodard & Curran is a national engineering, science, and operations firm with a simple vision for clean water, a safe environment, healthy communities, and happy people. As an employee-owned company, we strive to cultivate diverse teams and encourage collaboration in an equitable and inclusive culture. We seek talented individuals from all backgrounds to help us address a broad range of water and environmental issues. We prioritize our people, offering opportunities for professional growth, ownership, and flexibility. That’s how we make a difference to our clients, people, and the planet. **What’s in it for you:**
Woodard & Curran is offering a unique opportunity to join our Northeast Fiscal Solutions Team. This position is hybrid but attached to our Rye Brook, New York office. The Specialist will providefunding services to municipal clients throughout the Northeastand Mid-Atlantic United States, with specific focus in New York, New Jersey, Rhode Island, Connecticut, and Virginia. The successful candidate will be a motivated self-starter, a professional with a proven track record of helping clients identify and secure alternative financing for infrastructure projects. The selected candidate will work with Woodard and Curran engineers, planners and subject matter experts to help clients to find available and suitable state and federal opportunities to subsidize the cost of local projects. **Who are we looking for:**
Woodard & Curran has an exciting opportunity that will allow you to directly impact how we serve our clients by assisting them with obtaining funds to support their projects! The Fiscal Specialist’s primary responsibility is to identify and pursue state and federal funding for infrastructure, community development, and economic development projects that support our engineering practices. You will work collaboratively with municipal and other strategic client managers to identify funding opportunities and develop grant and loan applications/proposals to secure grant and/or loan dollars for projects involving water supply/treatment, wastewater systems, stormwater systems, community development, economic development, brownfields, hazard mitigation, etc. This position offers an opportunity to play a significant role in the project finance/funding process for an exciting division of our organization that delivers projects to public and private clients nationwide!

Flexible work environment and competitive benefits. Strong bonus potential. Relocation Assistance.
**Location:** Rye Brook, NY - Hybrid - in office 1 - 2 days a week.
**Travel:** Periodic client meetings, conferences, and training in Rye Brook, NY.
### **What You Will Be Doing at Woodard & Curran:**

* Under general direction, work with clients and Client Managers to identify environmental and economic development loan and grant-eligible projects with regional, state, and federal resources and develop, review, and edit loan and grant applications.
* Guide potential funding opportunities from conception through the application process and, if awarded, through implementation and administration.
* Interact with stakeholders involved in loan and grant-funding activities.
* Maintain comprehensive knowledge of particular areas involved in identifying and soliciting grants.
* Provide direct client guidance and input on various potential projects and funding applications.
* Prepare capital, operational, and other strategic plans, amendments, and revisions for municipal clients.

### **What You Will Need To Succeed:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Planning, Economics, Public Policy, Environmental Science, Engineering, Public or Business Administration, or related fields.
* A minimum of five (5) years of experience in planning various types of projects.
* Advanced knowledge of water resources planning, community development, economic development, and/or municipal capital project planning.
* Demonstrated understanding of the grant application writing process, including data gathering and research.
* Demonstrated knowledge of NYS, CDBG, US EDA, USDA, SRF and/or related funding programs.
* Demonstrated knowledge of tools and resources to calculate economic benefits/job creation resulting from capital improvement projects.
* Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple deadlines.
* Experience with the laws, rules, and regulations regarding public procurement practices and other environmental federal, state, and local regulations.
* Working understanding of the Engineering and Environmental fields.
* Ability to convey basic engineering topics, issues, and data to a wide variety of audiences.


This position’s anticipated pay range is provided above; final exempt salary or non-exempt hourly pay will be dependent on experience level as well as considering a % based geographic differential based on where the final candidate will be working. Geographic differentials are used to recognize and reflect cost of labor differences between geographic markets.**Benefits & Wellbeing** ***Retirement Savings:**** 401(k) Pre-tax or Roth Contributions: Company will match equal to 100% of the first 3% of salary contributed, All employees are eligible to participate in the 401(k) plan and are 100% vested in the value of own contributions and any employer matching contributions.

 ***Time away from work:**** Vacation time is provided to full and part-time regular employees. Vacation is accrued, based on number of hours worked per week as well as prior years of experience.
* Woodard & Curran offers paid sick time to eligible employees who are absent due to their own non-work related, illness, injury, or medical procedure.
* Woodard & Curran provides up to 80 hours of Paid Parental Leave for child bonding in a 12-month period.
* Company-paid short- and long-term disability insurance from Sun Life to assist with replacing a portion of your income in the event of non-job-related illness or injury. Eligible employees are automatically enrolled and eligible immediately.

 ***Coverage and support for your needs and wellbeing:***  

Personal and Family health: Company offers three medical plan options based on geography; plus HSA and PSA plans are available based on eligibility, additional options include dental and vision plans.  

Company provides basic employee group life insurance and AD&D benefits; additional voluntary life insurance for employee and family are available through Sun Life.  

WayForward powered by Dario: EAP Program combined with personalized mental health and wellbeing coaching.  

LiveWell wellbeing program: credit incentive is available, up to $600 annually – nutrition and fitness reimbursement, and access to the Virgin Pulse wellness platform.

Our success is tied to a culture that embraces our differences so that everyone can bring their whole, authentic selves to work. When our people are supported to reach their full potential, we provide the most innovative, sound, and effective solutions.***
